product_description.Dolby Vision: Dolby Vision makes the highlights brighter than ordinary TVs by up to 40 times, and it darkens the blacks by about 10 times. Thanks to that, you enjoy watching lifelike visuals on this TV’s screen.
product_description.Dolby Atmos: Whether you’re watching an action-packed movie or playing a game, you will find yourself in the thick of the action as Dolby Atmos delivers fuller and highly immersive surround sound that will leave you in awe.

I bought this TV with some expectation as I understood that this is an international brand. But not as expected.

What i like:
1) Light weight. Easy to cary. (But we don’t carry or change location all the time)
2) Easy to setup, hope most of the TVs now a days are simple to setup.
3) latest android and most of the apps are installable. How ever i saw still some app are not available but sufficient apps are available.
4) Happy with the 4K quality at this price range. Sony and Samsung have excellent picture quality but we need to spend 1/3 more money than this one.

What i don’t like:
1) Picture clarity for HD content where colours are not bright enough (even after changing multiple setting from options). So for regular videos like 720p quality or HD quality its not so good.
2) Black levels are badly controlled. When you see a night scene, darkness is really bad. Blackness will have lot of red dots which will definitely not give a good fell of watching it.
3) Navigation buttons on remote are very close especially down navigation & home button and up navigation and google voice assistance. When we try to use up and down buttons one will press home and google assistance buttons. So always we have to look at remote before operating.
4) Sound is average. I felt sound quality is same as a 6years old hd tv what i have. But little clear at high volumes. I have to check with an external out put.

Bought this TV in the inaugural sale with 5 year panel warranty, I am happy with my purchase and here are my thoughts after 4 days of usage

Pros:
1)The picture quality is really amazing, Clarity is also good.
2) HD channels look really great, SD channels look decent.(Yes only decent not great)
3)This TV shines while using the OTT platforms, you can truly experience the quality of the 4k panel while playing content on OTT platforms
4)Sound is also great, I don't think you require a Sound Bar even if you place the TV in the living room
5)Connectivity is seamless(Bluetooth, Wifi, HotSpot and Casting) have not noticed any issues till now

Now Cons:
1)Color Management:
I did not like the color management on this TV, especially Human Skin tones look a little Reddish.
I have seen the Iffalcon TV, I like the color management on IFFalcon TVs and this might be my personal preference.
You will notice the color management issues while watching TV channels from your Set Top Box.
In terms of contrast some channels look really dull and some channels look blown out like really high contrast.
Is this a broadcast issue or issue with the TV itself I don't know.
2) Quality of the Remote:
The quality of the remote is really bad, you can hold the remote in hand and tell it is made of cheap materials. The buttons too are not very good
3) Noticed lag in UI on the first day itself especially while using the Google assistant. I do not use Google Assistant regularly but I tried it just to
test and noticed significant lag.
4) Looks: You get what you paid for, this TV doesn't look premium at all. Anybody can look at the TV and say it's a budget TV

Product satisfies all the mandatory requirements one who looks to have an android TV.. Only one improvement could be in wall mounting bracket. May be one who is living in compact homes will find it bit risky of getting TV hit accidentally. Distance between TV panel and wall behind it is huge due to bracket depth is more comparatively. It should be short i guess. Leaving that its worth buying in this price range.

It's been a week since I am using the TV. The picture quality is really good and the sound is also decent. The response time of TV is also great. It's a great full-featured android TV. Chromecast, Bluetooth, and Wifi connectivity are very good. The picture quality and features of this TV is definitely better than MI, TCL, iFallcon, Nokia, Motorola and OnePlus for sure!

Please Note:-

1) I got the defective TV first and then it got replaced and reinstalled within 7 days so that was quite a bad experience for me. So please be careful about the TV because many people get defective TV when it comes to Hisense. That's the reason I have to give it 4 stars.

2) Hisense is also supplying TV to VU so FYI VU and Hisense are the same TVs. This is the reason I went for the Hisense as it's a bit cheaper than VU premium.

3) The SD channels will just be watchable on this TV, so I will suggest that this TV will be useless if you do not have HD channels. Just buy any HD TV if you wish to watch SD channels.

4) I got this TV @ Rs 32,999 only and got 4 years warranty that's the main reason I bought this TV.

Its been 14days of usage. Really good tv. Picture quality is just excellent. Sound is also clear and have good quality with average bass. This TV has Dolby vision, it will get activated when you play content which support dolby vision (I have seen some comment which mention that it doesn't have dolby vision). The operation is smooth, didn't experience any lag. I have purchased TV on 26th of July, so got 4years Manufacturer Warranty. Overall happy with the product. Initially i was little worried because of many negative reviews, stating screen bleeding issues.. But i guess the issue is with the initial batches, now its totally cleared by the company. Anyway you can go for it, below 30k, 4K Ultra HD tv, with dolby vision and Dolby atmos sound really worth it. It also support dual band wifi. I can't find any negative as of now, fully satisfied with the product. In between i just tried to call customer care just to get an idea about their service and responds, with ease, jst by dailing their customer care no, i got connected with the customer executive.. Overall great TV. Really impressed with the picture quality and color accuracy, its vivid, vibrant and beautiful. Played some 4k video of wifelife..oh my god.. just mind blowing. If you are looking for a 4k tv within 30k limit, then this tv is one of the best option. You just compare with Blaupunkt TV also.. it is also good and getting positive reviews. So you can go with either Hisense or Blaupankt.

So final verdict- Very much satisfied with the TV, picture quality - 10/10, Sound 7/10, connectivity- 8/10, Features - 9/10, Operation smoothness - 10/10

(If any issue occurs, I will update my Review for sure)

I was looking at 55 inch TVs in 30-40k kind of a price range and to be honest, I am quite choosy when it comes to relatively big ticket purchases. I researched a bit and found out about Hisense, it's probably the biggest brand out of all the budget TVs available, just that it is new in India. Bought this with a 3 year complete care warranty as well.

Pros:
Picture quality
Sound (Even 30 watt speakers sound amazing, I am going to connect it to additional speakers that I have, however the Tornado variant with JBL speakers is also available at a little higher price)
Dual Band Wifi, probably the only TV under 40k to offer and really important
16GB internal space makes it really comfortable and the performance quite smooth
Dolby Vision HDR with Ultra dimming make the experience really great.

Cons:
Just the one.. I wish the remote built quality was a bit better and the buttons more ergonomically placed (eg. You will end up pressing the home button quite frequently when you will want to press down)

All in all probably the best 55 inch TV that there is in the market even under 50k price range. A must buy!!

Best TV in this budget. I was waiting for VU, but it was not available till now. Finally bought this 55 inch

This is literally the best TV you can get in the price point as of today.. the colors are well calibrated in the calibration picture style.. you can further tweak the picture to your liking if you want.. the sound is actually pretty decent for an inbuilt set of speakers.. although i didn't use it for long.. the setting up hardly took any time.. i was a bit skeptical that there'll be light bleeding.. but it's a VA panel as far as i know and there's very little bleeding.. the colors are really uniform.. but where it really shines is HDR 4k content.. i can assure you .. you can not get a better picture quality anywhere else at this price point even near this price point.. overall if at all this thing comes into stock again.. go for it.. it's a good deal!

Hisense TV met the expectations and has been functioning seamlessly. The connectivity is good, 4K clarity is as advertised. The impressive part is the sound, the 30W is quite sufficient. I did not see a need for a sound bar or other accessories. The voice remote as well is functioning good. The drawback was with installation, the technician was not so well knowledgeable. Everything is perfect for the price in this TV. Wished it had dedicated fully functional MEMC also. Else, Picture quality is just great. Black levels are Awesome.
TIP: while watching in dark, use good quality LED STRIP on the back of TV Panel, it inhances the TV experience to the next level. In this way, you enjoy OLED type black levels.

Superb picture quality, crisp colors and deep blacks. Good viewing angles, despite having a VA panel. Sound is not very thumping as you expect in a tv speaker, but very loud and clear. Build quality could have been better, specially the stands, feels a little clumsy. Design is awesome, literally bezel-less in three sides. HDR and Dolby Vision contents are treat to eyes. I played PS4 Slim on this, no such input lag noticed in sport games like FIFA, UFC and NFS, HDR is nice and crisp, played RDR2, Battlefield, world and characters look very rich and detailed. MEMC isn't there, so motion blur is noticeable. I just hope now it would have a good longevity. Overall, a good value for money!!

Picture quality good. 4k videos are outstanding.
Sound is loud enough with clarity. No need for a soundbar, though don't expect any magic with the supposed dolby atmos inbuilt.
Gets booted quickly.
Upscaling is good for 720 and 1080 not so much for lower resolutions.
Strangely hdmi cec doesn't work properly with Yamaha soundbar Y 108 and in fact requires cranking up the volume quite high when connected to the soundbar. Sounds better without the soundbar though the bass is a bit muted.
Remote is a pain. The TouchPad needs to be looked at visually to use it. Too close to the Google assistant button which gets pressed mistakenly everytime you use the top most part of the TouchPad.
Bluetooth works well. Headphones get connected instantly once you pair them.
In conclusion more of a value for money tv

An affordable Android TV. This is near bezelless design which implies that there are small bezels on the 3 sides. Supports 4K videos and the UI is intuitive. Sound is also good for a medium size living room (do not see an immediate need for external sound bar). Supports if not all most of the Apps (Netflix, Prime, Hotstar, Zee5, LIV, YouTube). The remote control has dedicated buttons for major apps. Not experienced any lag till now and works smoothly.

I am writing this after 2 months of usage.

TLDR; If you are just upgrading from an older and less smart TV , this will serve well. But if you already have used good TVs this may disappoint you slightly.

I got this delivered in just 2 days and got it installed in the next 2 days, so the delivery and service were awesome. Now lets come to the TV performance.

Pros
- Decent picture quality
- Good amount of storage
- Android-based TV
- Have almost all ports
- Sound loudness is impressive

Cons
- It is sometimes a bit laggy and skips some remote commands when its unresponsive, this doesn't happen frequently, so overall it is smooth.
- Picture quality is good, but there are TVs with better picture quality in the same range. eg. Toshiba.
- Sound quality is just average and all these Dolby Atmos are just a gimmick. If you are into classical music/Bollywood classics, this will disappoint you because the voice clarity isn't good.
- Remote control is poorly designed and has bad ergonomics.
- My TV keeps developing an issue with the home launcher where it stops navigating vertically and the normal selection turns into a long press (just on the home screen). I reset my TV and it got fixed, but only for a couple of days and it was back to square one. This is just annoying.
- As many others have pointed out, The sound output over the Bluetooth and 3.5 MM jack is too low to hear that I need to increase the volume 3 folds.

TV started flickering intermittently on the 4th day after installation. Yet to ascertain whether it's a transmission problem or TV. Not impressed with the sound. Company has been wanting on providing accessories, making the customer pay for flexible wallmount, HDMI purchase and supply the same which does not support 4K. Promised replacement the next day, still awaiting for the replacement.

Review.
The flickering was a transmission issue. The promised replacement of HDMI cord supplied by JEEVES was not supporting 4K resolution. Flipkart too washing off hands by putting onus on customer to pay first Rs 350 paid service and later claim reimbursement. The customer is advised to buy a voltage stabilizer, HDMI CORD for better signals and flexible wall mount for better handing of TV. Flipkart reduces price of TV by Rs 1000 in a couple of days after purchase. I assume the prices of products are manipulated as the search about the product is done.

Review
1) Flipkart should state that the product needs voltage stabilizer as the installation engineer recommends.
2) The description of Hisense remote states color screen, which is not so and misleading.

Workmanship:
No tie-cord used to tie loose wire spread around the tie. Reflects improvement in workmanship.

HISENSE
Either reduce cost of wall mount. The installation engineer states drawback of fixed WM and advantages of a flexible wall mount convincing the buyer to opt for a flexible WM costing Rs 1600 extra.
Instead company can provide a HDMI Cable which the buyer has to purchase for Rs 280 on being convinced for getting digital signal.
He advises to opt for a voltage stabilizer to safeguard the product from voltage fluctuations. This costs another Rs 3100.

1. Wifi connectivity is comparatively low.
2. A setting should be in TV, so TV directly boot into hdmi. So we dont have to use 2 remotes. A OTA update is urgently required.
